Reviews.Title: “False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom "apartment" and were told that it could sleep up to 4 adults. This was highly important for us as there was a goup of us travelling for business and needed flexibility with our numbers. When we got there we found it was 2 tiny bedrooms with no living area, no dining area, no kitchen and could only sleep 4 adults if they were prepared to share the double beds in each bedroom. When we complained to the owner/manager about a lack of living area he pointed to the 2 sqm space next to the bed, hardly a lounge area. The bathroom was tiny and you couldn't sit on the toilet without hitting your knees on the wall. The second bedroom didn't have a cupboard, only some hooks, and there was barely enough space to put a suitcase. The price wasn't cheap compared to real 2 bedroom apartments for rent. The front room was noisy as it is located next to a gay bar with a beer garden where people were drinking and making noise late into the evening. Would definitely never stay there again and it was only lucky that we were mining people who had stayed in some pretty average conditions in remote locations around the world that we agreed to stay. That and the fact that the mining conference we were attending had booked out virtually all of the other accommodation in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “The worst, O pior, die schlechteste, le pire, Det Verste, 最悪のle pire”
Reviews.Author: MarcosGalindo
Reviews.Content: You can not consider this as a hotel... I arrived with my 8 years son at 1 am in toronto and there was nobody in the reception.. We knocked the door several times, we called to the phone number that was on the door... Nobody answered.. we stayed there for more than 20 min and nothing. When I arrived there, taxi driver could not believe that small house was actually a hotel... from outside and at night it looked like adam´s family house... not a good energy and not a good view... at all. It was not really pleasant to find a hotel at that time with a child... Next day, i sent a message to the hotel explaining what happened and the manager said the would charge me anyway... Tried to explain situation to booking and nothing... There are many, many options in Toronto better than this place, for the same price and with better location.

Reviews.Title: “Average no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: LianaFox
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a trip through Toronto. The hotel itself was very average and a little noisy but at least the staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Geat location ,clean and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Leanne M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel from Nov.14 to Nov.19 while husband was in hospital having surgery. The staff and management were friendly and very helpful. Every day I was asked how he was and if I needed anything. The few requests I did make were seen to very quickly. As a woman alone I felt completely safe because of the system they use. Also was given very good advice on places to eat and shops to go to. Stayed in room 23 and found it to be very clean....no problems whatsoever. Would and did recommend it to others. Location was perfect. Rooms are not large but are very comfortable. Will be staying at the hotel whenever I have to stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “no help when you need it, and bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Anna H
Reviews.Content: The noise started at 10 p.m., hard rock from radio, television? turned up full blast, continued till 1 a.m. Resumed at 5:30 a.m. Requests to turn volume down ignored. No management available to turn to. No number to call for help, no front desk, no supervision, no foyer. Final bite: bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it, not even if you are trying to save money”
Reviews.Author: Sean D
Reviews.Content: I could put up with the cramped rooms (my suitcase barely fit in the room). I could also put up with the misrepresentation on the website (room did not have a pull out couch as promised) I could even put up with a lack of on site management staff (they are no where to be found, only a maid who was very friendly and nice). It was tough to deal with NO AC (they don't leave the remotes in the room and cut the circuit breaker so it doesn't work unless requested). What really started upsetting me was not having my phone calls to management returned to fix the AC. I was also really pissed off when I was accused of being too noisy because I was blow drying my hair. This was a blow dryer supplied by the hotel and I was doing this at 8pm on a Saturday night. This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at, not because of cleanliness (it was clean) or even the cramped space provided, it was the horrible service from management and constantly feeling alienated during my stay. Not worth it if it was free, stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “A tiny place to stay”
Reviews.Author: halifaxborn
Reviews.Content: The Wellesley Manor is hardly a "hotel" -- it has just 11 rooms, no lobby, no fitness centre, no food service. My first clue that it was something unusual was an e-mail the day before my arrival, asking what time I might be there. Turned out that they are basically not staffed, and since I showed up at a time they were not expecting an arrival, I had to buzz, then phone, before somebody came to let me in. However, I was then love-bombed with two separate staff members showing me to my room, pointing out how the TV and air conditioning worked, assuring me that I could phone for service 24/7 if I needed it, and making sure I felt welcome. The place is a Victorian house, at one time a doctor's office, converted a few years ago into a B-and-B before the management concluded that nobody wants to pay for an inn breakfast in a neighbourhood like the Village, just off Yonge Street a quarter-mile south of Bloor, which is thick with restaurants. I think they've done a good job with what was there. The room I was in had a double bed, but it would've been a tight squeeze for two people to stay there. Likewise I wouldn't have wanted to entertain, or even maybe spend much time relaxing in the room. For what I wanted -- somewhere to sleep after a day of meetings, before heading off to more meetings -- it was just fine, and probably the cheapest decent accommodation within walking distance of Yonge and Bloor. Other notes: Room was adequately dark at night, very quiet at all hours. Extremely clean, no bugs. Fridge in room, very cold. Lots of hot water, though it took a while to warm up. Air conditioning not powerful, but adequate. I never saw another guest all the time I was there, though I was told the place was nearly full. Tiny courtyard behind the building with patio chairs, where I read for an hour in the afternoon. Proprietor very keen to chat about his ambitions for the business.

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back”
Reviews.Author: buffSimcoe
Reviews.Content: Air conditioner did not work for most of the time we were there, management comments were "it doesn't feel too bad to me". Not willing to give a discount, even though we fixed their total paper holder for them (fell off the wall completely when using the paper) and our room was right next to the front door (which banged shut) every time someone came in. We are a family of five, so wasn't really enough room to spend 2 days in. Management seems nice and friendly until there is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small and nobody around to help”
Reviews.Author: merchy20
Reviews.Content: It is in a great location being right across the road from Wellesley subway station. Access to the hotel could only be gained by buzzing the intercom (which nobody responded to). I had to phone the hotel from outside using my cell phone which after a long flight was annoying. I was shown to my Bronze single room on the basement level which was quite small (picture looked slightly bigger than the room) but expected for a boutique hotel and it was reasonably priced considering the location. The room was quite cool considering I visited during a heat wave. Be aware that a basement room will mean you get noise and small vibrations from Wellesley subway station but I got used to it quickly and it didn't bother me. I didnâ€™t use the air conditioning much, but it worked fine like everything else. The shower was big and powerful enough, and the room was fine as a base camp. There wasnâ€™t much of a presence from the hotel staff (the office was outside at the back of the house and it wasnâ€™t clear if anyone was in). The inaccessibility of the staff when I needed something was disappointing (checking out took longer than it should as I had to phone the office to make sure someone was present to collect my key card). If you have few demands and want a no-frills place to sleep and shower with good transport links and you have little luggage, this choice is alright.

Reviews.Title: “I never recommend this place to anyone. Horrible”
Reviews.Author: wadujay04
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thro' Expedia. No one there to check in and no help at all for anything. I got a very tiny room in the basement after waiting so long. I was very upset since they did not care for my prior requests. They blamed Expedia for that. Could not get any sleep since subway vibration hit my head. They did not care at all. horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worse place to pick!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dontbother1
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this place. The pictures are better than what you get. There is no front desk. no one to greet you. You press the button and they tell you to go to the back. No one is never around. No parking for your vehicle and they do not help you to find a place for the parking. The rooms are so small, you have no room for the luggage. You have to put the luggage on the floor because you have no desk or dresser at all. Never again will I even think of going to such a horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Place to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: Alex231Rob
Reviews.Content: Hosts are a no show. They buy the place and they are not there. Only the maid. I booked on line so they put me in the basement. Room was half painted and was a mess. No extra towels. One roll of tolit paper. Room was very noisy. I asked to change rooms. The owner on the phone said no as I booked on the Internet. They had other rooms for abit more as I would have paid more but they said no. If you book online they put you downstairs. The maid was also upset for what the owners did to me. I would stay away from this place. I had some food to reheat and they would not give me a Microwave as I would pay extra for it and I would but due to booking with Redtag they don't care. I had some people come over for dinner and had to say sorry to them for the condition of the room. They said that was not nice of the owner to do that. Stay away from this place and go to a normal hotel. You would be better off than this place. They should be ashamed of themself for doing this to people like me and others.

Reviews.Title: “cozy and feels like neighbor”
Reviews.Author: ppl_watching
Reviews.Content: I was really surprise and happy, both my stay and the place, I visit TO whenever I feel the need to getaway and feel the big city vibe, Hotel, its so usual and I lost its interest, coz they are pretty much the same, I was surfing the net and came across this place, the photo they have is pretty much accurate, I wasnt really sure what to expect knowing its a Manor but to my surprise I really enjoy my stay, the service is pretty much staright forward didnt really have to call the supervisor coz there was nothing wrong, the room maybe small but its expected, the shower room is clean to my liking, I like it that there was no musty smell in the room, its quiet, the bed is fine, not as soft but at least there is no spring poking my back. the location, close to little store and restaurant, whats best is I get to used the subway, explore TO and get to places using the subway. Definitely will come back to this place, I hope they will maintain the cleanliness and the cost..

Reviews.Title: “Homely place that's at a good location”
Reviews.Author: kevinchang0812
Reviews.Content: It's one of those affordable hotels that is clean and feels cozy. They don't provide services that are offered in the 5 star chain store hotels but the owner is really nice and will answer your questions and help you with things. She is very approachable and friendly. The hotel is just right across from the subway and there are a lot of places to eat and visit beside the hotel. The space in the bedroom is not big, but at the same time it's great value for such a cheap price in a convenient area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little spot. Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: bjr777
Reviews.Content: Close to Yonge St and restaurants. Right across the road from the subway. A wonderful little spot for a different kind of Toronto hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: GingerHaveSoul
Reviews.Content: The wellesley manor is very well located, just in front of the wellesley subway station. The staff is friendly and helpfull. My room was not very big but was clean. They have high speed internet (not crappy wi-fi) and there is a little backyard where you can sit and smoke :)

HotelInfo.Name: Wellesley Manor
HotelInfo.Address: 29 Wellesley Street East, Toronto, Ontario M4Y 1G7, Canada
